{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3426851,"name":"david","username":"howlongismyname","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/howlongismyname/{size}/134767_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-24T20:43:39.256Z","cooked":"

Hi!

I’m looking for 2-3 people who are new to robot design and motivated to learn it before the season. You’ll be testing research on experimental approaches to learning design from scratch, which will be used for resource development. FRCDesign.org will be the primary resource.

I will use a modified reverse classroom model and communicate via public text chat. There will not be any lessons taught, so I expect you to do the work on your end. (Though I will help guide your learning!)

You do not need to have a knack for engineering, though having a season of FRC experience would be nice.

For YPP and development purposes, all interactions will be in a public discord community without private messages. Do note this.

Do note I do not need a student for this; if you are an interested mentor, I will need you to have the daily time available for practice.

What you will get:

  1. Personalized design mentoring and accountability
  2. Prompt (same day) feedback and daily follow-up.
  3. Advanced learning techniques based on current research that allow you to learn design fast. You may be able to design a full robot yourself before build season from zero (if you put in the required time).

What we need from you:

  1. The motivation to learn daily.
  2. 2-3 hours a day of uninterrupted time at home. (Have a lot of free time to burn on robotics)
  3. A screen recording software + video uploading setup. This is used primarily to review how you CAD and your mistakes. (YouTube unlisted, then uploaded to a public FRC Discord Community)
  4. The willingness to struggle and try new and difficult things.
  5. Having very little to no knowledge of frc design and cad. (Preferably a mechanical or programming person looking to make the jump)

If interested, message @howlongismyname and @AndrewCard and talk about your team and your context.

Thank you!

It would be the equivalent of going through stages 0 - 3, and with consistent practice, it will probably take until kickoff.

Assume daily practice, but occasional breaks are okay.

Looking for 1 adult (for ypp) who hasn’t had any experience in Onshape in addition to FRC cad to run through an updated experimental intro to FRC CAD course for about 5 hours between 4:30PM and 9:30 PST tomorrow. (Monday)

I’ll sit down with you for the whole period and by the end you should be able to have a good grasp on CAD fundamentals for FRC to start learning FRC design in a comfortable way.

Message me ASAP if interested.

Thank you!
